instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, fans spin, no chime
threads.message:
Hello,


I got this logic board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, got a green light, both fans spin, no chime. I retouched the joints of <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>, nothing changed.


<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> is 0.825V

<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is 3.3V

<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> is 0,896V


Anything else to measure? Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, fans spin, no chime
threads.message: PRAM reset done?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, fans spin, no chime
threads.message: I did reset PRAM, no luck.Is <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> at 0.825V OK?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, fans spin, no chime
threads.message: Vcore is fine. Does a USB mouse light up? Any other history?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, fans spin, no chime
threads.message: USB mouse is lighting up. No history, thought... other than no water damage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, fans spin, no chime
threads.message:
Do a PRAM reset with an external USB keyboard. Disconnect the internal keyboard. USB mouse is lighting up so the board is doing something. 
Is GPU Vcore present on L8930?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, fans spin, no chime
threads.message:
Hello Duke,

Disconnected keyboard, did PRAM reset with external kb, GPU Vcore on L8930 is 0,895V...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, fans spin, no chime
threads.message: Is GPU Vcore on L8930 measuring 0,895V correct? What else can I measure?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, fans spin, no chime
threads.message: How do you know you did a PRAM reset? Is the board chiming now? L8930 is correct voltage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, fans spin, no chime
threads.message: For some reason now it chimes every time I start it. So with external keyboard I did PRAM reset. I still get no image/backlight. How do I know that I get an image but no backlight, or if I get no image at all?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, fans spin, no chime
threads.message: 5V present on L9000? Hold flashlight to apple logo and check for image. Is the LCD known good?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, fans spin, no chime
threads.message: LCD is known good. L9000 is 5V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, fans spin, no chime
threads.message: There is most likely an image then. Hold flashlight to the Apple logo and check

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, fans spin, no chime
threads.message:
I can't see anything. Disconnected display, plugged a monitor via thunderbolt. Booted from battery and ASD OS test hangs at the following point in verbose mode:


<SIGNAL>MACX_SWAPON</SIGNAL> SUCCESS


Booting from USB with El Capitan in verbose mode hangs at:


fInterfaceSnapshots is missing


Running ASD Efi shows the desktop but I get the error





Sensor Voltage (VBLC) --Backlight (test1) = Error - Sensor is reading below the low limit.

threads.message:
Would this 

[url]https://www.ebay.de/itm/NEW-TL866CS-Programmer-Adapter-USB-EPROM-FLASH-BIOS-6-Adapters-Socket-Extractor/232681462362?hash=item362ce55a5a:m:mb1ZGy0Nq_st7Newwg_2mAA[/url]

do the trick? Since this SPI chip has the legs parallel to it, not bent 90 degrees, do I need a special adapter to connect?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, fans spin, no chime
threads.message: Or, can I use my Arduino?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, fans spin, no chime
threads.message:
Just get a TL866 and a ZIF adapter for the BIOS chip.

Here you find the narrow and wide variant, just get both.
[url]https://www.ebay.co.uk/itm/SOIC8-SOP8-tO-DIP8-Programmer-IC-Socket-Adapter-Conveter-5-4mm-3-9mm-Chip/182742983407[/url]
